attributes.action: Change the approach to the handling of Covid-19 restrictions.
attributes.additional_details: To get our economy working again, people back to work, children back to school in order to save our economy and the welfare of our people.
attributes.background: Implement a different strategy/approach to help our economy recover by applying a different model: Covid-19 Dedicated Hospitals, Secure Care Homes, Advice vulnerable to self-isolate, Accelerate vaccine program, Lift restrictions on the economy/businesses and countries people.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.
	
We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Clinically extremely vulnerable people in Tier 4 areas are already advised to follow shielding guidance. You can find out more here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/guidance-on-shielding-and-protecting-extremely-vulnerable-persons-from-covid-19/guidance-on-shielding-and-protecting-extremely-vulnerable-persons-from-covid-19 

Decisions on hospital capacity, how beds are allocated, and the facilities and services available in any given hospital is an operational decision for the NHS, Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCGs) and individual trusts, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

You may wish to sign these petitions: 

Fund & provide services to allow the vulnerable to shield & re-open the economy: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552023

Lift local lockdowns and Covid-19 restrictions in England: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551469
